org.strykeforce.thirdcoast.swerve

Class Wheel

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.strykeforce.thirdcoast.swerve.Wheel

  • public class Wheel
extends Object
    Controls a swerve drive wheel azimuth and drive motors. The azimuth and drive Talons are configured using TalonParameters named "azimuth" and "drive", respectively.

    The swerve-drive inverse kinematics algorithm will always calculate individual wheel angles as -0.5 to 0.5 rotations, measured clockwise with zero being the straight-ahead position. Wheel speed is calculated as 0 to 1 in the direction of the wheel angle.

    This class will calculate how to implement this angle and drive direction optimally for the azimuth and drive motors. In some cases it makes sense to reverse wheel direction to avoid rotating the wheel azimuth 180 degrees.

    Hardware assumed by this class includes a CTRE magnetic encoder on the azimuth motor and no limits on wheel azimuth rotation. Azimuth Talons have an ID in the range 0-3 with corresponding drive Talon IDs in the range 10-13.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Wheel(CANTalon azimuth, CANTalon drive)
      This designated constructor constructs a wheel by supplying azimuthTalon and driveTalon talons.
      Wheel(int index)
      Convenience constructor for a wheel by specifying the swerve driveTalon wheel number (0-3).

    • Constructor Detail

      • Wheel

        public Wheel(CANTalon azimuth,
             CANTalon drive)
        This designated constructor constructs a wheel by supplying azimuthTalon and driveTalon talons. They are initialized with Talon configurations named "azimuthTalon" and "driveTalon" respectively. Assumes the Talon configurations have been registered.
        Parameters:
        azimuth - the azimuthTalon CANTalon
        drive - the driveTalon CANTalon
        See Also:
        TalonParameters.register(UnmodifiableConfig)

      • Wheel

        public Wheel(int index)
        Convenience constructor for a wheel by specifying the swerve driveTalon wheel number (0-3).
        Parameters:
        index - the wheel number

    • Method Detail

      • set

        public void set(double azimuth,
                double drive)
        This method calculates the optimal driveTalon settings and applies them.

        The drive setpoint is scaled by the drive Talon setpoint_max parameter configured in TalonParameters. For instance, with an open-loop setpoint_max = 12.0 volts, a drive setpoint of 1.0 would result in the drive Talon being set to 12.0.

        Parameters:
        azimuth - -0.5 to 0.5 rotations, measured clockwise with zero being the wheel's zeroed position
        drive - 0 to 1.0 in the direction of the wheel azimuth

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stop azimuth and drive movement. This resets the azimuth setpoint and relative encoder to the current position in case the wheel has been manually rotated away from its previous setpoint.

      • setAzimuthZero

        public void setAzimuthZero(int zero)
        Set the azimuthTalon encoder relative to wheel zero alignment position.
        Parameters:
        zero - encoder position (in ticks) where wheel is zeroed.

      • getAzimuthSetpoint

        public double getAzimuthSetpoint()
        Return the azimuth position setpoint. Note this may differ from the actual position if the wheel is still rotating into position.
        Returns:
        azimuth setpoint

      • getDriveSetpoint

        public double getDriveSetpoint()
        Return the drive speed setpoint. Note this may differ from the actual speed if the wheel is accelerating.
        Returns:
        speed setpoint

      • isDriveReversed

        public boolean isDriveReversed()
        Indicates if the wheel has reversed drive direction to optimize azimuth rotation.
        Returns:
        true if reversed

      • getAzimuthAbsolutePosition

        public int getAzimuthAbsolutePosition()
        Returns the wheel's azimuth absolute position in encoder ticks.
        Returns:
        0 - 4095 encoder ticks

      • getAzimuthTalon

        public CANTalon getAzimuthTalon()
        Get the azimuth Talon controller.
        Returns:
        azimuth Talon instance used by wheel

      • getDriveTalon

        public CANTalon getDriveTalon()
        Get the drive Talon controller.
        Returns:
        drive Talon instance used by wheel
